Text: Will this tutorial work for autodesk inventor suite 2008

how the fuck do i open this??
the exe file is starting but then disappears.. Help !
I will try it our, i see 25 seeders, so am assuming it must work regardless of the bad opinions, anyone share the idea? If it works for me i'll come back and post a response

Works GREAT (for me)! using XP Pro SP3 32bit. Unrar and run STARTCD. Don't know what else to add.. wasn't magic.. Suggest a good Computing 101 book for those who can't seem to get anywhere on this one.

This is badass! I have never seen this formta before, where the heck did you get this? I had to right-click and run as Administrator, and the format opened for me and you can even view in a Video Mode! That is too cool! I am impressed! I know Inventor very well, I have a Degree in Computer Drafting & Design, but I love tutorials so I checked this out! I will help seed for as long as I can, and I thank you for this upload!

@coldgamer: Dude, the interface for 2010 changed dramatically between the 2010 and the 2009 versions. Download one of the newer versions from here and install that instead. Trust me; ALL of the 2010 versions of ALL of the Autodesk software have changed their interface to the "MIcrosoft Ribbon" format. You will see what I mean if you look at the 2007+ versions of MIcrosoft Office and then compare the top of the screen to those applications. Leanr the new version, the old ones will just throw you off. I started learning AutoCAD and all of those back in 2008 and then they switched up on me in mid-stream! It is fucked, I know, but you have to go with the flow man. If Autodesk changes, man, you got to learn the new version, that is all there is to it! Good luck!

Steps for running these video tutorials for Windows XP:
1. Unrar these compressed files.
2. Make a virtual CD from the resulting files by using PowerISO.
3. Put this Image file by using PowerISO or any Virtual CD Softwares.
4. CD will run WELL.

Hint: - You can find PowerISO in this URL:
http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/6566450/PowerISO_v4.8___Serials_%5BChattChitto_RG%5D
        - Make Virtual CD by using PowerISO:
          I. Open program from its main icon.
         II. Put selected files inside the main window (Drag and Drop).
        III. Save the file an *.iso, *.daa, or *.bin.
